Cost of Living asks us to watch, like voyeurs, as two able-bodied characters lovingly minister to two disabled ones...Perhaps we even wonder how we ourselves would function in the same situations. But for all the emotional and physical expressiveness of the actors, and the interest conveyed by the charactersâ€™ relationships and often funky dialogue, the play remains basically a series of situations in search of a plot.
